title: Goa - the land of tranquil and scenic backwaters (Dimpy Roy)
text: By Dimpy Roy Sep 23, 2015 Goa, a perfect beach destination, is the smallest state in India located on the western coastline of the country on the Arabian coast. Most noted for its sun, sand, and beaches, the state is a lot more than just that. For instance, the history of the place is long and checkered. For nearly 500 years, starting from 16th century till 1961, it remained a Portuguese occupied territory on Indian soil. During the long course of their dominance the place got significantly influenced by their culture, religion, traditions, architecture, lifestyle, as well as cuisines. Today, the whole province is evenly dotted with the Portuguese colonial buildings, churches, cathedrals, bungalows, etc. The old boulevards and narrow streets still retain the charm of the old days with the old cafes serving food and beverages in the same old-fashioned ways. The place is already one of the most visited places in the country and there is a steady increase in the number of visitors year after year. A relaxing stroll at one of the scenic beaches, satisfying your appetite with sumptuous seafood, a spiritually refreshing visit to the old revered churches, a walk through time in the narrow streets with old houses featuring small balconies on both sides of the street, and relishing a genuine hospitality at the budget beach cottages in Goa, a holiday in the state is an experience of a lifetime.For the tourists, Goa has numerous tourist attractions spread all over the province that further have no shortage of cool things to do. Given below are some fun distractions and activities that will keep you busy while you explore the place.Ride a bike - There is perhaps no other better way to explore the state other than exploring the tourist attractions on a bike. Goa is well-connected via roads and they are in excellent driving condition. Getting into different parts of the state riding a bike on roads that pass through lush green surroundings, colonial buildings, and run alongside the coast is simply an experience hard to match with. The good thing is that bikes are easily available for hire on a rental basis. You will be required to carry the necessary documents like valid license, registration details, etc. Besides, if you don't how to ride a bike you could always hire the scooter taxis, which are the specialty of Goa.Visit Anjuna Flea Market - From shopping to relishing street food to getting yourself a tattoo, you can do it all in the Anjuna Flea Market. It is held on every Wednesday on the Anjuna Beach, one of the most popular beaches in the state. The flea market is a large and bustling market where you can find anything that is under the sun. While you are in the area do not forget to check out St Michael's Church, the village, and the beach. Backwater kayaking - There are multiple backwaters and waterways in Goa that are the excellent escapades for those who like to explore the state through its waterways. Sal backwaters, Mandovi River, Zuari River, and Nerul River are the popular sites for kayaking and boating. Kayaking through the mangroves, flora and fauna, and lush vegetation of the state not just brings you close to the nature but it also provides a relaxing retreat.Goa is further full of additional amazing tourist activities that you can indulge in. Visit the destination on your next vacation and spend a holiday full of fun, entertainment, and adventure. Delhi is a popular transit point to access Goa. Plus, it is also a good tourist destination. Simply hop on a Goa to Delhi train, get into Delhi, and get busy exploring its amazing tourist attractions. About the Author Dimpy Roy, a travel blogger, writes about Goa to Delhi train for travellers. She writes about places to visit there, things to do, best budget beach cottages in Goa also. Rating:
